page.title: 17LOCAL HISTORY THE RAILWAY
page.content: The first type of railway in Govilon was the old tramroad,which was opened in 1922.It ran from Nantyglo Ironworks down to the Wharf at Govilon.The owner of the tramroad was Crawshay Bailey.Many songs were written about his love of engines.Part of this old tramroad route was absorbed by the Merthyr,Tredegar and Abergavenny Railway in 1859.The railway was used to transport goods and passengers.It's coming brought a decline in the usefulness of the canal and tramroads.At it's peak it was a valuable source of employment,for at least one third of the Govilon population worked there.The line closed in 1958 and parts of the old track have been made into Nature Trails.
